column4: my wireless has suddenly stopped seeing available networks... it has been working fine for months... what could this be?
yeah i think so.. i remember something about it...
but as i say, it was working before i left the house, i took my laptop to uni and tried got on the uni wireless, and now im home it wont see ANY connections
ok well should i try to uninstall it?
could that be a bad move though
i dont know what i use, im a noob
yeah im scared to try it in case i am actually using it... thanks for sharing ;p
my wireless has suddenly stopped seeing available networks... it has been working fine for months... any ideas what could have happened?
The card or antenna may have come lose.  Does Ubuntu notice you have a wireless network card?
Well, does the network icon that shows wireless status show bars still?
You can add the wireless network?
Your antenna might have come loose.
Or your card may have been damaged.
Not really.  You can try 'iwconfig' to make sure it's recognized as a wireless card.
You might have accidentally disabled the card, but I'm not sure where that would be done.
